intro: Clonodia racemosa, commonly known as the clustered raceme plant, is a flowering species native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly referred to as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, often with a slight pubescence. Clonodia racemosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
